snippet: Books on the history, influence and attempted overhaul of the New York City Public Library system; the life and times of the city’s first black police officer; and the transformation of Washington Heights.
abstract: Sam Roberts reviews books Reading Publics: New York City's Public Libraries, 1754-1911 by Tom Glynn, Patience and Fortitude: Power, Real Estate and the Fight to Save a Public Library by Scott Sherman, Crossing Broadway: Washington Heights and the Promise of New York City by Robert Snyder and One Righteous Man: Samuel Battle and the Shattering of the Color Line in New York by Arthur Browne.
lead_paragraph: Books on the history, influence and attempted overhaul of the New York City Public Library system; the life and times of the city’s first black police officer; and the transformation of Washington Heights.

headline.main: Sam Roberts on Books About the New York Public Library, Washington Heights and the City’s First Black Police Officer
headline.print_headline: A City of Patience and Fortitude
